title: Great, clean Sans with straight-sided W
content:
A great, timeless sans but it's name eludes me..

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [tumblr\_nju45kQHsa1qa2g6fo1\_540.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150220005635/http:/typophile.com/files/tumblr_nju45kQHsa1qa2g6fo1_540.jpg) | 62.61 KB |
author: joeandreas

comments.content:
Based on the code of their website, it appears to be a bespoke typeface called HM Atem:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150220005635im_/http:/typophile.com/files/atem_4336.png)

The HM apparently stands for the firm Hello Me, who created the typeface and identity:  
 [http://tillwiedeck.com/2013/02/atem/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150220005635/http:/tillwiedeck.com/2013/02/atem/ "http://tillwiedeck.com/2013/02/atem/")
Great detective work, and some fine work from Hello Me too. I've just realised the W in question is an inverted M, so maybe I can try doing that with a similar face.
